gameview.gView

Class GState

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameview.gView.GState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener

    public class GState
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, javax.swing.event.ChangeListener
    Gamestate of JGoL, initializes a mappanel and severall other views such as figurelist etc for the playing phase. Basically this is the interface for the players. Can receive and send events which are neccessary for the playing phase.
    Author:
    Figedi

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GState(PlayerGameView pGV, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.awt.Point> radioCoordinates, java.awt.image.BufferedImage map, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> languageMap)
      Constructor for MapView, creates a basic instance of the gameview (nonscaled) and other Views (not filled with data)

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      Gamestate wide actionPerformed method, this method handles Station Clicking on the map and COnfirmationbutton-Clicking

      Adds a figureIcon on the map

      Helper method for setRadioMap/resizeHMap, adds all figures from figurelist on the map according to its type
      void addFigureToList()
      Helper method for the figureList, this method fills the List with Data

      Add the GamePanel on the Mainframe
      void destroy()
      Destroy all relevant gamestateData and remove panels from MainFrame

      Helper method for inittabbar (for contents of thief tickets)
      void initalizeJList()
      Initializes the JList element on the right, showing all figures of the game

      Helper method for initgridbaglayout, initializes the confirmationbutton for player movements

      Helper method for initgridbaglayout, initializes the checkbox for doubletickets
      private void initFigureLabel()
      Helper method for initGridgbaglayout, initializes the yourfigure label
      void initGridBagLayout()
      Init the gridbagLayout and put all basic elements on the orientationpanel
      java.lang.String initializeConfScreen()
      Initializes a decision frame if more than one ticket is available for a move
      void initializeLabel()
      Initialize the top status element, this one shows roundcounter and several status messages which are important to the game
      private void initializeListListener()
      Initializes the Listeners for the sidebarJList
      void initializeSlider()
      Initialize the slider element for manual map zooming
      void initializeTabBar()
      Initializes the TabBar element with Stats about thieves
      private void initJTables()
      Initializes the jtables within the tabbar
      void initMapScroller()
      Init the drag and scroll feature with this method and on top of that the mousewheel zoom feature
      void initPlayerChangeScreen()
      Initialize the playerChangeScreen, this screen removes the orientationpanel from mainframe and puts an own panel on the mainframe, thus hiding all gamedata so players can change seats
      private void initScrollPane()
      Helper method for initGridbagLayout, initializes the scrollPane
      void processEvent(IAEvent e)
      This method processes incoming events and changes gameData by calling the needed functions
      private void processFigureKilled(IAEvent e)
      Helper method for processEvent, this method processes a figure killed event (removal from figurelist, figurequeue, and the status cache, then updating the game elements)
      private void processLogicGameState(IAEvent e)
      Helper method for event processing, this method processes all game relevant events
      private void processLogicGlobal(IAEvent e)
      Helper method for event processing, this method processes all global relevant events (such as language switch)
      private void processNextFigureData(IAEvent e)
      Helper method for processEvent, this method processes a next figure event (choosing new position, figureid, thievetoshow, thievelog)
      private void processNextFigureUpdate(IAEvent e)
      Helper method for processEvent, this method uses the changed next figure data and updates the GUI elements
      private void processNextRound(IAEvent e)
      Helper method for processEvent, this method proccesses a next round event (status update)
      private void processPgVButtonPressed(javax.swing.JButton refButton)
      Helper method for button pressed while a human player moves, determines what ticket to choose or autochooses the only possible ticket then sends playermove to logic
      void registerChosenPosition(java.lang.String pos)
      Helper method for actionPerformed, this method registers a position when the user clicked on the map On top of that, the scrollreference is set to this point, so when the user zooms, it is being centralized to that point
      void repaintImage()
      Repaint method for theMapPanel, this method deletes the old Panel and sets up a new one Use when new Figures should be painted on the map or the zooming factor has changed
      void resetImageSize()
      Resets the Image size (resetting scalingfactor to 1.0)
      void resizeHmap(double xFactor, double yFactor)
      Resizes components of the mappanel, for example Station coordinates are multiplied with the scalingfactor or figure sizes
      void scrollToPoint(java.lang.String currentPos)
      Scroll to a point on the map (with centralization)
      void sendPlayerMove(java.lang.String token)
      Helper method for actionPerformed, this method sends to the event system a move of a player The position is already chosen when clicking on the map on a available point
      void setRadioMap()
      This method paints all figures in figurelist on the map.
      private javax.swing.table.TableModel setTHiefPositionData(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> data)
      Helper method for data filling of thief position screen.

      method for the slider, is called when the slider value is changed and updates the scalingfactor

      switch the language of the gui

      Helper method for the cellrenderer of the figureList, determines whether to highlight a cell or not
      private void testZoomRules(int id, java.lang.String position)
      Helper method for the figurelist, determines whether to scroll to a figure or not

    • Constructor Detail

      • GState

        public GState(PlayerGameView pGV,
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.awt.Point> radioCoordinates,
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage map,
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> languageMap)
        Constructor for MapView, creates a basic instance of the gameview (nonscaled) and other Views (not filled with data)
        Parameters:
        pGV - the playergameview, used for fireing events
        radioCoordinates - the coordinate map with the position data for each station
        map - a BufferdImage containing the actual map read from resourcecache
        languageMap - the languagemap for multilanguage purposes

    • Method Detail

      • setRadioMap

        public void setRadioMap()
                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        This method paints all figures in figurelist on the map. On top of that, it puts the buttons on the map with the positions saved in originalButtonList
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - in case the new mappanel in the repaint procedure is built too slow, this one could throw a nullpointer

        Parameters:

      • testZoomRules

        private void testZoomRules(int id,
                 java.lang.String position)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Helper method for the figurelist, determines whether to scroll to a figure or not
        Parameters:
        id - the figureId which is selected
        position - the Stationposition
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if a selection is out of range or nulled in figurelist due to sync reasons, log the result

      • testHighlightRules

        private void testHighlightRules(java.awt.Component component,
                      boolean isSelected,
                      int idx)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Helper method for the cellrenderer of the figureList, determines whether to highlight a cell or not
        Parameters:
        component - The component of the cellrenderer, call by ref
        isSelected - the boolean indicating whether a selection is made
        idx - the index of the selection
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if a selection is out of range due to sync reasons, log the result

      • addFigureToList

        public void addFigureToList()
        Helper method for the figureList, this method fills the List with Data

      • sendPlayerMove

        public void sendPlayerMove(java.lang.String token)
        Helper method for actionPerformed, this method sends to the event system a move of a player The position is already chosen when clicking on the map on a available point
        Parameters:
        token - The token which should be chosen for the move

      • registerChosenPosition

        public void registerChosenPosition(java.lang.String pos)
        Helper method for actionPerformed, this method registers a position when the user clicked on the map On top of that, the scrollreference is set to this point, so when the user zooms, it is being centralized to that point
        Parameters:
        pos - the Stationname on which the user clicked

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Gamestate wide actionPerformed method, this method handles Station Clicking on the map and COnfirmationbutton-Clicking
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        e - the event

      • processPgVButtonPressed

        private void processPgVButtonPressed(javax.swing.JButton refButton)
        Helper method for button pressed while a human player moves, determines what ticket to choose or autochooses the only possible ticket then sends playermove to logic
        Parameters:
        refButton - the button which is pressed, only the confirm button is being used here

      • destroyOldView

        public void destroyOldView()
        Destroys the mapPanel

        Resets the Image size (resetting scalingfactor to 1.0)

      • repaintImage

        public void repaintImage()
        Repaint method for theMapPanel, this method deletes the old Panel and sets up a new one Use when new Figures should be painted on the map or the zooming factor has changed

      • resizeHmap

        public void resizeHmap(double xFactor,
              double yFactor)
                throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Resizes components of the mappanel, for example Station coordinates are multiplied with the scalingfactor or figure sizes
        Parameters:
        xFactor - scalingfactor for x-axis
        yFactor - scalingfactor for y-axis
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - in case the new mappanel in the repaint procedure is built too slow, this one could throw a nullpointer

        Parameters:

      • addFigureIcon

        public void addFigureIcon(java.lang.String stationName,
                 java.awt.image.BufferedImage picture,
                 java.awt.Color color,
                 boolean paintTransparent)
                   throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Adds a figureIcon on the map
        Parameters:
        stationName - The referencestation for coordinate reasons
        picture - the picture of the figure
        color - the figurecolor
        paintTransparent - boolean indication whether the figur should be painted transparent, for possiblethieves
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - in case the new mappanel in the repaint procedure is built too slow, this one could throw a nullpointer

      • stateChanged

        public void stateChanged(javax.swing.event.ChangeEvent e)
        method for the slider, is called when the slider value is changed and updates the scalingfactor
        Specified by:
        stateChanged in interface javax.swing.event.ChangeListener
        Parameters:
        e - the state has changed event
